item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:82, topic:312876”]How many times do I have to point out to new people like you that I have not played runescape in 2 years. The reason runescape is still in my name is because I follow the forum rules, having one account and one account only. I do agree that quote trains are retarded and will warrant a warning, but I do have to agree with abraham2119. The only way we will be able to get rid of you is get up your nutsack until you leave. SO GET THE FUCK OFF THESE FORUMS UNTIL YOU HAVE LEARNED THE BASICS OF THE INNER WORKINGS OF THE INTERNET. According to:

SECTION 91,B OF THE COPYRIGHT SHAREHOLDERS ACT, 1996(SWITZERLAND) ON LINE 25 “ALL USERS OF THE INTERNET ARE, AS SHAREHOLDERS, RESPONSIBLE FOR IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF THE INTERNET FOR OTHER SHAREHOLDERS OF ANY RACE, RELIGION OR MENTAL / PHYSICAL ABILITY. ALL SHAREHOLDERS HAVE AGREED TO AND HOLD THIS RESPONSIBILITY. ANY NONCONFORMITY TO THIS AGREEMENT CAN AND WILL LEAD TO TERMINATION OF YOUR CONNECTION TO THE INTERNET, RESULTING IN ALL SHARES PLACED UNDER YOUR OWNERSHIP TO BE RETURNED TO THE SOLE GOVERNOR OF THE INTERNET AND ALL RESPECTIVE PARTIES.”

You are NOT improving the quality of the internet for anyone and you shall therefore get the hell out of here before you are disconnected by the International Internet Shareholder Enforcement Team(IISET).

[sub][size=1pt]The previous quoting of ‘section 91,B of the Copyright Shareholders Act, 1996(Switzerland)’ is purely fictional and should not currently be taken seriously, unless, by pure coincidence there is in fact an Act stating information along the lines of that portrayed previously.[/size][/sub][/quote]Stfu?

item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:77, topic:312876”]No there isn’t; it is NOT POSSIBLE. Quit misinforming people, you idiot.
ps: using the “%xx encoding” doesn’t work. Hi there unescape()[/quote]
Who the fuck said anything about unescape? I didn’t and you’re pea-brain obviously can’t compute what I am trying to say. I am talking about a different type of encoding you idiot.

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:78, topic:312876”]You sir are a complete retard and have no use here. The statement you just made is incorrect in every possible way. Where the hell would the browser get this “wrong” code? Is this the code it produces once interpreted? If so, then this woul… Fuck it, as I am posting this, I am finding no logical way this could work(you could make the browser interpret differently, but you can’t make it output the correct result from totally different source code(That is valid))and thus your theory is incorrect.

Your post has broken my brain and my post may now also be invalid.[/quote]
Anyone who has the word RuneScape in their name obviously is a retard to begin with, so don’t blame me for your obvious stupidity.
And you obviously don’t even know how to use google, for when you search “hiding php code” it is the first to come up. Next time make sure that you know a little about the topic before flaming? K.

@Abraham - Making quote trains is retarded when you add no further comment.

item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:76, topic:312876”]I think that it got worse when the flaming REALLY started after it got moved…

Think about it logically. If your web browser can render the page for you to see, it must have gotten the source somehow, correct? Your browser isn’t just guessing what to render, it is being told what to do by SOURCE CODE. If your browser can get it, you can get it, no exceptions.

Very true, but there are ways of allowing the browser to read the correct code but interpret it differently, so it will display the wrong source to the potential code-thief.[/quote]
You sir are a complete retard and have no use here. The statement you just made is incorrect in every possible way. Where the hell would the browser get this “wrong” code? Is this the code it produces once interpreted? If so, then this woul… Fuck it, as I am posting this, I am finding no logical way this could work(you could make the browser interpret differently, but you can’t make it output the correct result from totally different source code(That is valid))and thus your theory is incorrect.

Your post has broken my brain and my post may now also be invalid.

Read full topic

item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I think that it got worse when the flaming REALLY started after it got moved…

Moparisthebest:

Think about it logically. If your web browser can render the page for you to see, it must have gotten the source somehow, correct? Your browser isn’t just guessing what to render, it is being told what to do by SOURCE CODE. If your browser can get it, you can get it, no exceptions.

Very true, but there are ways of allowing the browser to read the correct code but interpret it differently, so it will display the wrong source to the potential code-thief.

item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

This thread is quite funny I must say. And watching it play out gave me a bit of entertainment. But in all honesty, Telenim is right. Some scripts taken from other websites, and a bit of HTML, a website does not make. It does, but it’s just not up to the standards held by most members of these forums.

This would make a dandy website for Moparscapers though, which is why it shouldn’t matter what Telenim says. Someone somewhere might want this. You should really work on your design of the webpages before you release another ‘website’. Web Design is a strange art, and isn’t as simple as copying images from other websites.

plus, davidi2 = dumb lool.
